instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U5701: What is U5701? this is the keyboard controller chip that takes the keyboard and trackpad input and turns it into a USB device signal for the machine to process. If replacing a keyboard doesnâ€™t fix an issue with keys not typing, check all traces between keyboard connector and this IC. This chip has programming so it must be replaced from a similar, ideally identical board. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No trackpad
threads.message:
Working on a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no trackpad. Found that <SIGNAL>PP18V5_Z2</SIGNAL> is missing on the connector, confirmed <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4_TPAD</SIGNAL> is present. Traced it to <CHIP>U5805</CHIP> and found the following readings.

1 - 0.053
2 - 5.07
3 - 0.000
4 - 0.185
5 - 0.001
6 - 0.000
7 - 0.000
8 - 0.037



So I replaced it but having the same results. Any ideas ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No trackpad
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5_CUMULUS</SIGNAL> is present???' If yes, try another trackpad..... <SIGNAL>Z2_BOOST_EN</SIGNAL> should be high but it wont if trackpad is not detected...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No trackpad
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No trackpad
threads.message: On L5800 I have 5V on pin 1 but nothing on pin 2 Based on schematics and board view I should have a filter there however these just look  like test points ? Im confused.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No trackpad
threads.message: Sorry my mistake, schematic says pin 18 not connected for Z2 Flex, try another trackpad and flex cable.........

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No trackpad
threads.message: L5800 is NO STUFF so it's not on the board. Is the keyboard working?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No trackpad
threads.message: The keyboard is working but covered in corrosion.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No trackpad
threads.message: I'd first try a known good trackpad+cable. After that you need to check all connections from the connector to <CHIP>U5701</CHIP>, could be corroded trace.
